Tell Idaho lawmakers to oppose HB 419! It is rooted in the unfounded idea that Muslims seek to impose Islamic law in U.S. courts and it spreads anti-Muslim sentiment.
  

HB 419 is anti-Muslim and un-American.

HB 419 will have serious unintended consequences, creating confusion and legal nightmares for many Idaho families. Contact the House State Affairs Committee and tell them to vote against this legislation.

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

For the third year in a row, Representative Eric Redman (R-Athol) has introduced a discriminatory "foreign law bill" with the intent to target only one religious group – people of the Muslim faith.

Contact the House State Affairs Committee and tell them to vote against this legislation!

Make no mistake, even though HB 419 (commonly known as the anti-Sharia law bill) uses coded language and avoids direct reference to Islamic Sharia law, it is motivated by an unfounded concern taking hold across the country that Sharia law is taking over our courts. There is no evidence of this taking place in Idaho and the First Amendment already prohibits U.S. courts from imposing religious law as civil law. In other words, the anti-Sharia law bill is a solution in search of a problem.

Beyond its harmful and discriminatory intent, HB 419 also has the potential to create significant unintended consequences in the everyday lives of Idahoans who marry abroad, file for divorce, adopt children from overseas, or conduct other family matters that involve foreign or international law. It will also be bad for our economy, driving away multinational corporations that might otherwise settle or conduct business in Idaho.

Call or email members of the House State Affairs Committee and tell them to vote against this unnecessary bill. You can find contact information for the committee members on the Idaho Legislature website.

Don't know what to say? We have put together talking points that can be used to guide discussions with lawmakers when encouraging them to oppose this legislation.

Once scheduled, we'll be announcing the date, time and location of the bill hearing via social media. Follow us on Facebook and Twitter today!

Sincerely,

Kathy Griesmyer
Policy Director
ACLU of Idaho
